BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: AMERICAN COMMUNITY SCHOOL OF ABU DHABI

IRS990.OtherOrganizationDsc: Not for profit day school for PreKG - Gr12

OtherExpensesGrp.Desc: Other School Activities and General Admin

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: It is available on the school's website https://www.acs/join-us/admissions Schedule E, Part I. Line 6 - The American Community School of Abu Dhabi is recognized by the US State Department - Office of Overseas Schools - as providing a significant benefit to the US Government and it qualifies for financial grants to assist in carrying out its educational programs.

Schedule E, Part I, Line 6 - Schedule E, Part I. Line 6 - The American Community School of Abu Dhabi is recognized by the US State Department - Office of Overseas Schools - as providing a significant benefit to the US Government and it qualifies for financial grants to assist in carrying out its educational programs.

Schedule F, Part I, Line 2 - The American Community School of Abu Dhabi utilized the accrual method of accounting. Books and records are maintained in UAE dirhams (AED). For purposes of 990 reporting the dirhams are converted into USD at the average rate. As there has been no change in the average rate for years (UAE dirhams are pegged to the USD). There is no currency adjustment required to the beginning balances. The American Community School of Abu Dhabi is recognized by the US State Department - Office of Overseas Schools - as providing a significant benefit to the US Government and its affiliates and it qualifies to assist in carrying out its educational program.

Schedule J, Part I, Line 1a - Schedule J Part I. Line 1 a - Annual Home Leave and housing are provided to all key employees and certain members of the faculty and their dependents. All benefits are determined by the Board's Policy.

Schedule J, Part I, Line 1a - Schedule J Part I. Line 1 a - Annual Home Leave and housing are provided to all key employees and certain members of the faculty and their dependents. All benefits are determined by the Board's Policy.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6 - Form 990, Part VI Section C Line 18 - 01. Parents of students comprise the membership and elect the Board of Trustees. 02. Member election for additional members (part IV. Line 7a) Members vote annually for the Board of Trustees. 03. Governing body decisions (part VI. Line 11a) Governing body decisions can be appealed by a parent to the Board, but a parent can not overrule the Board's decision. 04. Form 990 governing body review (part VI., Line 11a). The 990 is prepared by the Finance Director and reviewed by the Board of Trustees and Superintendent prior to submission. 05. Conflict of interest policy compliance (part VI, Line 12 c) All Board members are required to sign a conflict of interest document once they are elected to the Board of Trustees. 06. CEO, executive director, top management compensation (Part VI. Line 15a) In determining superintendent compensation, the Board obtains information from comparable schools and solicits input from the State Department Office of Overseas Schools. A committee of the Board makes recommendations as to compensation for approval to the entire Board. 07. Other officer and key employee compensation (part VI, Line 15b) Compensation for key employees is based on salary scales for those positions. These scales as well as any subsequent adjustments require Board approval. 08. Governing documents, etc. available to the public (part VI. Line 18 and 19). All financial documents and tax returns are available for inspection in the business office of the school. No special requirements are made for inspection. Any party only need to apply for access in the Schools Main office.
